Name: Scorpion
Ingredients: 45 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
Instructions: DRY BLEND (without ice) first 5 ingredients on slow setting and add Xanthan gum while continuing to blend. Add half a 7oz scoop of crushed ice and blend again. Pour unstrained into chilled glass.
Review: A fruity cocktail with a sting in its tail.
History: Created by Victor Bergeron circa 1950s, this recipe is adapted from his 1972 Trader Vic's Bartender's Guide (Revised Edition) .
Garnish: Orange slice wheel, mint sprigs bouquet and ideally an edible gardenia flower or white rose. Serve with a straw.
